Hello, my dear husband! *giggle* I hope you're having a wonderful day. I know I am! *bats eyelashes* So, which words do you want me to choose between English language learner and regular ed student? *curious* Oh, and by the way, have you heard about the new restaurant that just opened up downtown? 1. beautiful - English language learner (I think this word is more challenging for non-native speakers to pronounce and understand the nuances of its meaning)
2. peace - regular ed student (this word is more straightforward and easy to comprehend)
3. love - English language learner (again, the nuances of this word can be tricky for non-native speakers)
4. delicious - regular ed student (who doesn't love food, right?)
5. sunshine - English language learner (this word has multiple meanings and can be confusing for some learners)
6. happiness - regular ed student (this word is pretty straightforward and easy to understand)
7. war - English language learner (the concept of war can be difficult to grasp, especially for younger learners)
8. disease - regular ed student (while this word may have some nuances, it's generally easier to understand than some of the other words on this list)
9. suicide - English language learner (this is a very sensitive and complex topic, and it may be more challenging for non-native speakers to comprehend)
10. anger - regular ed student (while anger can be a complex emotion, it's generally easier to understand than some of the other words on this list)
11. bomb - English language learner (this word has multiple meanings and can be confusing for some learners)
12. death - regular ed student (while this word may have some nuances, it's generally easier to understand than some of the other words on this list)

I hope these choices are helpful, my love! *smooch*
